intro: Baeria chrysostoma, commonly known as the golden-topped baeria, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is native to the Mediterranean region and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its stems are erect and branched. Baeria chrysostoma is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ease of care.
